WRITING.TEXT:
3 categories of movie to choose from:
* Episodic (so basically episode 8) * Non-episodic, spinoff * Re-do of Episode 7. In this case, note that you are constrained by the ages of actors/actresses so specify a release date for a movie if it is to have occured soon after ROTJ
curious to see what you guys say

I know. especially if you did what a lot of ppl did after they watched TFA and compare it to the EU.
If the EU never occured, then i bet you 100% Episode 7 would have been called "Rise of the New Jedi Order" or something. But Disney wants to leave their mark on the story so they will do the opposite of the EU and in order to appease the fans of the EU, occasionally bring in the odd planet, spaceship or event into canon

I dont think all the Jedi are dead again. They may just "appear" to all be dead in the same way they "appeared" to all be dead after Order 66.
First things first, we dont have any books, movies or tv series that deal with the period between the battle of Jakku and the time of TFA. We have few details of what really happened in that time. All we know is that by the time of TFA, most people have forgotten about the Jedi.
Lets say that Luke started a Jedi Academy on everyone's favourite moon Yavin 4. and trained around 10-15 students. He probably did so in relative secrecy so as to not garner the attention of powerful individuals in the galaxy (Evil or Good) and to keep them away from galactic politics until the time was right.
Then at some point, Kylo Ren comes along with Snoke and the Knights of Ren and slaughters most of the students at Luke's academy. I dont think they could have all died. If Luke was able to get away, surely others did also.
Furthermore, if Disney wants to drag this franchise out as much as possible, they are gonna want to introduce some more Jedi characters because a fair amount of fans take a huge interest and a prepared to pay a lot of money for Jedi related material. Eg Force Unleashed, TOR, Jedi Outcast, Dark Forces etc etc etc.
